name: B P International

reviews.title: nosiest hotel from hell
reviews.text: i cant believe it. just now 11/28/07 at 11.05 pm i look outside my door to find guitar noise is coming from, there are 15-20 people playing guitar and making the most racket. besides that there are loud noises from emanating from the wall.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: its incredible. for the price u pay to stay here you could pay half the price for a flop house and get more peace of mind.
reviews.title: A nice hotel

likes.liked: — The great view of the harbour, especially at night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: dont stay at BP. u will regret it!!!
reviews.title: Nice, adequate hotel for base in Hong Kong

reviews.text: Husband and I stayed here for two nights in October 2007. A nice pleasant hotel. Room size decent, not as small as some of the readers suggested. The bathroom was for one person at a time only!
reviews.title: would stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would stay again though. In a good location and decently priced.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was in a great location just off Nathan road. The hotel intself was very nice and the front desk and service was good.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room and bathroom were alittle bit small but when you are out sightseeing and shopping all day this does not matter. We had a great view from our room and we were not on the top floor !!! As for Hong Kong itself, we stayed for 4 nights and this was abit too long and we were ready for our onward journey after the 3rd day. A visit to Kowloon Park behind the hotel is very nice with lots of stuff to look at.
reviews.title: Good Choice

reviews.text: We had the great fortune to stay at this Hotel during a visit to Hong Kong in November. We purchased an Octopus card at the airport which not only took us directly to the hotel but this card could also be used at other outlets, for example if you wished to buy water or other things at certain shops, and other travel around Hong Kong. We also used it to travel back to the airport when leaving and any credit not used was returned to us. An excellent idea. The hotel was very well situated and within walking distance to the Star ferry. The lobby of the hotel was very impressive and the breakfast was varied and more than adequate. The staff were very helpful. Our room was not huge but then we did not spend much time there. The room was kept very clean and overall, staying here was a Good Choice. I would certainly return and have no reservations about recommending it.
reviews.title: Very good Hotel in a Top-Location !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good Hotel in a superb Location within a short walking distance to the Temple-Street, Jade Market and Nathan Road. The Kowloon Park is just 2-3 minutes away. Friendly reception staff. Small but nice and clean rooms with refrigerator and Aircon. Nice view from our room (Harbourside) Nr. 1828 in the 18th floor. All in all absolutely value for the money.
reviews.title: Good value hotel; good location.

reviews.text: Stayed at BP International in Sept 2007 after reading good reviews on tripadvisor. We weren't disappointed!
reviews.title: Poor Experience

likes.liked: — The staff and the size of the rooms.

reviews.text: We were impressed by the modern and elegant design of this hotel -- from its lobby to its hotel rooms. Staff are friendly, helpful and accommodating. The hallways and the room itself looked and smelled clean and fresh unlike other 3-star hotels that we've stayed before. Location is also good -- with Kowloon park and Parklane blvd just beside it, and the Jordan MTR stn (which will take you to anywhere you want to go in HK) just a 3-min walk. We've had no problem with our stay except that we weren't able to charge our mobile phones as their outlets are different from the Europe and U.S. plugs (be sure to buy your adaptor!).. Other than that, overall experience was great. We will definitely recommend this hotel to our relatives and friends who will visit HK -- really GOOD value for your money.Ü
reviews.title: This hotel exceeded my expectations.

reviews.text: More than decent nearly no-frills hotel and more than decent hotel staff. Very convenient, as it's a short 3min walk to Nathan Road and 5min to the Jordan MTR stn. Temple St Night Mkt is an extra 10min walk but the market is overrated, filled with poor quality Mainland Chinese merchandise. From my room, I had a nice view of Kowloon Park, with HK island to my right. Supermarket chain Wellcome and 7-11 (with a sushi chef to boot!) are just across the street.
reviews.title: Very convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I always book this hotel or the Shamrock hotel. It is clean and a good location. 5min walk to Jordan subway station and 1 minute from kowloon park.
reviews.title: Good choice, my 3rd time

reviews.text: Sometimes you can hear plumbing, ie people taking a shower in other rooms but not too noisy.
reviews.title: Value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Would recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're looking for an above average, moderately priced hotel in HK, then this hotel fits your needs. It's conveniently located in Tsim Sha Tsui so there's food, shopping, and access to the public transportation. I don't know when they redid the rooms, but the rooms are nicely furnished and clean. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. As already mentioned, they're moderately priced and IMO worth it.
reviews.title: Great hotel, but small rooms

reviews.text: The only con is the size of the room and especially the bathroom. If I was travelling by myself, this room will fit fine, but if you're travelling with your spouse, then you might find it small. The bathroom barely has enough room for one person. You step into the bathroom, turn once and you'll be at the sink, turn again and your facing the toilet, and the turn one more time and you'll be facing the shower. That's how small the bathroom is.
reviews.title: Modern and cheap

likes.liked: — size of bedrooms and new bathrooms. Restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I had a great experience and I'd recommend this hotel to others.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

likes.disliked: — walls are too thin and service was quite cold

reviews.text: This was not a hotel I had heard of before, but would happily return to again. The 'BP' stands for Baden-Powell and is headquarters for the Hong Kong Boy Scout movement, but that does not impinge on the operation of the hotel or the hotel guests. The double rooms had twin beds only and that should have been made clear at the time of booking, but the rooms were a good size, clean and the bathrooms looked recently refurbished in stainless steel and glass. There is a hot and cold water dispenser at the end of each floor, but the tea and coffee making facilities in the room were more than adequate. One evening we had the buffet evening meal which was advertised in the lift and it was something out of this world. I cannot think of a single thing which was not part of the buffet, hot and cold seafood, meats, salads and those desserts were unreal, especially the individually steamed chocolate souffles!!
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Value.

reviews.text: This is very good hotel, with an excellent location in Kowloon (i.e. it took us 10 min by foot to get to the Star Ferry to go to the HK island, the Temple Street Market, the jade market - and 15-20 min to go to Mong Kok) and a good rate. The room was very nice, with a view overlooking the city, the park of Kowloon and part of HK island, so we could even enjoy the Symphony of Light from our room (ask the harbour parkview room). The only negative part would be that the walls are very thin (we could hear when the guest next door was leaving/coming back) and if you're a non-smoker, make sure you ask for the non-smoking floor (we would sometimes smell cigarette smoke). I would definitely go back there and will recommend it to anyone who wants to stay in HK. The staff was polite but not very friendly, but it did look like a very busy hotel (reception was always crowded). It is also the Scout center so it is quite funny to pass by tourists, businessmen and... young (and older) scouts in the hotel lobby!
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay

aka: b p International Hotel Hong Kong
description: please add this hotel.. is a lovely and not very expensive place to stay in hongkong with an affordable price
